meanings.definition: To go back on a promise or commitment.
meanings.sent1: She was reneguing on her promise to help with the project.
meanings.sent2: He renegued on his agreement to meet at the park.
meanings.sent3: The friend kept reneguing on their plan to go hiking, causing frustration.
meanings.sent4: His actions were reneguing on the trust they had built over time.
meanings.sent5: The politician's reneguing on his campaign promises disappointed many voters.

meanings.definition: To fail to fulfill an obligation or agreement.
meanings.sent1: They were reneguing on their responsibility to pay the rent on time.
meanings.sent2: The company renegued on their promise to deliver the order by Friday.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept reneguing on its duty to catch mice in the barn.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds reneguing on their promise of rain left the farmers worried.
meanings.sent5: The student's reneguing on submitting the assignment led to a lower grade.

meanings.definition: To break a promise or agreement.
meanings.sent1: He was reneguing on the pact they had made in secret.
meanings.sent2: She renegued on her commitment to attend the event.
meanings.sent3: The puppy kept reneguing on its vow to not chew on the furniture.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds reneguing on their agreement to bring rain surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's reneguing on his pledge to train hard disappointed his coach.
